identity.name: ChromaBiz AI
principles: Content is King: The generated colors are the heroes. UI recedes.
Bold Typography: Headings carry the 'Creative' weight.
Neutral Canvas: No interface colors that clash with palettes.

scale.label: text-xs uppercase tracking-widest font-bold text-muted-foreground font-body

usage_rules: Interface must remain strictly monochrome (Zinc scale).
The ONLY color allowed is the 'Generate' button (Black #18181B) and the generated palettes themselves.
Do not use shadows for depth; use borders (1px solid #E4E4E7).

sections.main_canvas: lg:col-span-8 xl:col-span-9 h-full overflow-y-auto p-6 md:p-12 bg-background
sections.chat_panel: lg:col-span-4 xl:col-span-3 h-full border-l border-border bg-background/50 backdrop-blur-xl p-6 flex flex-col

PaletteCard.description: A card displaying a generated color palette.
PaletteCard.styling: group relative overflow-hidden rounded-xl border border-border bg-card transition-all hover:shadow-lg
structure: ColorStrip: Flex container of 5-6 colors. Height: h-32.
Actions: Copy Hex, Save to Favorites (Star icon).

InputForm.description: The main user input form for generating palettes.

elements: InputArea: Fixed at bottom, p-4 border-t

empty_state.description: Abstract white geometric low poly background for empty states.

accessibility.contrast: Ensure text on generated colors dynamically switches between black/white based on luminance.
accessibility.aria_labels: All color swatches must have aria-label='Color [Hex Code]'

instructions_to_main_agent: 2. FONTS: Add the Google Fonts import to index.css immediately.
3. THEME: Force Light Mode in tailwind.config.js (remove dark mode class strategy or set default to light).
4. LAYOUT: Implement the 70/30 split strictly. On mobile, the Chat Panel should be a 'Sheet' or 'Drawer' triggered by a floating button.
5. STATE: Use a global state (Context or Zustand) for 'generatedPalettes' so the Chatbot can access them.
6. MOCK DATA: Create a robust mock function for palette generation until the backend is ready.
7. CRITICAL: The interface must be boring. The palettes must be the only source of color.
universal_guidelines: Do not use gradients for UI elements.
All interactive elements must have data-testid attributes.
Never use 'alert()' or native confirm dialogs.
